description: RECOMMENDED INSTALL. KrakenD dashboard based on Prometheus integration via OpenTelemetry

panels.description: Total incoming HTTP Requests in the selected period
panels.title: Total HTTP Requests

panels.description: Average requests per second over the selected period
panels.title: Avg Throughput

panels.description: The Average Response Time in the selected period
panels.title: Avg Response Time

panels.description: Total number of proxy requests
panels.title: Total Proxy Requests

panels.description: Total number of attempted connections  to backends (failed or not)
panels.title: Total Backend Requests

panels.description: Average allocated memory per instance
panels.title: Avg memory in use

panels.description: An average of the total memory reserved per instance in the period
panels.title: Reserved memory

panels.description: Total number of Go routines (internal threads) running in the gateway per instance. Go routines manage the incoming traffic, background operations and other maintenance tasks.
panels.title: Go Routines

panels.description: The worst latency seen during the selected time
panels.title: Worst latency

panels.description: The percentile 99 tells you that 99% of  HTTP server requests have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Latency  p99

panels.description: The percentile 95 tells you that 95% of  HTTP server requests have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Latency  p95

panels.description: The percentile 90 tells you that 90% of  HTTP server requests have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Latency  p90

panels.description: The percentile 75 tells you that 75% of  HTTP server requests have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Latency  p75

panels.description: The percentile 50 tells you that 50% of  HTTP server requests have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Latency  p50

panels.description: Average response size of data payloads per second in the selected period
panels.title: Avg data throughput

panels.description: Pie chart of status codes.
panels.title: Response Status Codes Distribution

panels.description: Numer of request per second received
panels.title: Throughput (RPS)

panels.description: Average response latency
panels.title: Avg Latency

panels.description: The percentiles tell you the percentage of requests that responded within a time.
panels.title: Latencies (Percentile)

panels.description: Bytes sent in body responses during the selected period. Headers excluded.
panels.title: Response data size  (payloads)

panels.description: Average response size of data payloads in the selected period
panels.title: Avg reponse data size (payloads)

panels.description: The worst proxy execution has a latency matching this number
panels.title: Worst proxy latency

panels.description: The percentile 99 tells you that 99% of the proxy executions have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Proxy latency 99p

panels.description: The percentile 95 tells you that 95% of the proxy executions have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Proxy latency 95p

panels.description: The percentile 90 tells you that 90% of the proxy executions have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Proxy latency 90p

panels.description: The percentile 75 tells you that 75% of the proxy executions have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Proxy latency 75p

panels.description: The percentile 50 tells you that 50% of the proxy executions have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Proxy latency 50p

panels.description: Number of incomplete responses returned to the user on aggregation (matches X-KrakenD-Complete header)
panels.title: Incomplete responses per second

panels.description: Number of proxy errors per second seen in the selected period
panels.title: Proxy errors per second

panels.description: The worst backend connection has a latency matching this number
panels.title: Worst backend latency

panels.description: The percentile 99 tells you that 99% of the backend connections have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Backend latency 99p

panels.description: The percentile 95 tells you that 95% of the backend connections have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Backend  latency 95p

panels.description: The percentile 90 tells you that 90% of the backend connections have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Backend latency 90p

panels.description: The percentile 75 tells you that 75% of the backend connections have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Backend latency 75p

panels.description: The percentile 50 tells you that 50% of the backend connections have a latency below this number.
panels.title: Backend latency 50p

panels.description: The average response size of backends within a second
panels.title: Avg backend traffic

panels.description: Number of backend errors per second seen in the selected period
panels.title: Backend errors per second

panels.description: Numer of request per second received
panels.title: Throughput (RPS)

panels.description: Average response latency

targets.expr: sum by (http_request_method, http_route) (rate(http_server_duration_sum{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$interval]))/sum by (http_request_method, http_route) (rate(http_server_duration_count{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$interval]))

panels.title: Avg Latency

panels.description: The 95 percentile tells you that 95% of the requests responded within this time.

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by(le, http_route, http_request_method) (rate(http_server_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$interval])))

panels.title: 95p Endpoint Latencies

panels.description: Bytes sent in body responses during the selected period. Headers excluded.
panels.title: Avg response size per endpoint

panels.description: Average bytes sent in body responses for each endpoint during the selected period. Headers excluded.
panels.title: Average response size per endpoint

panels.description: Bytes sent in body responses during the selected period. Headers excluded.

targets.expr: topk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route) (rate(http_server_response_size_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance"}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Total response size per endpoint (top $max_list)

panels.description: Fastest endpoints to respond

targets.expr: bottomk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route) (rate(http_server_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route!=""}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Fastest p95 endpoints (top $max_list)

panels.description: Slowest endpoints to respond

targets.expr: topk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route) (rate(http_server_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route!=""}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Slowest p95 endpoints (top $max_list)

panels.description: Count of HTTP response status codes over time
panels.title: Response Status Codes

panels.description: Distribution of status codes over time
panels.title: Response Status Codes

panels.description: Histogram showing the latency of responses over time.
panels.title: Latency Heat Map

panels.description: Histogram showing the size of payloads of responses over time.
panels.title: Response Size Heat Map

panels.description: Numer of request per second received
panels.title: Throughput (RPS)

panels.description: The Endpoints Average Latency

targets.expr: sum by (http_request_method, http_route) (rate(krakend_proxy_duration_sum{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$interval]))/sum by (http_request_method, http_route) (rate(krakend_proxy_duration_count{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$interval]))

panels.title: Avg Endpoint Latencies

panels.description: The Endpoint p95 Latencies

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by(le, http_route, http_request_method) (rate(krakend_proxy_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: 95p Endpoint Latencies

panels.description: Fastest endpoints by looking at the percentile 95

targets.expr: bottomk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route) (rate(krakend_proxy_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance"}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Fastest endpoints (p95 - top $max_list)

panels.description: Slowest endpoints by looking at the percentile 95

targets.expr: topk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route) (rate(krakend_proxy_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", http_route!=""}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Slowest endpoints (p95 - top $max_list)

panels.description: The latency heatmap
panels.title: Latency Heat Map

panels.description: Number of BACKEND request per second executed
panels.title: Throughput (RPS)

targets.expr: sum by(http_request_method, http_route, server_address) (rate(http_client_duration_sum{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval]))/sum by(http_request_method, http_route, server_address) (rate(http_client_duration_count{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: The time it takes for a request to have the first byte of the response body ready to be read.

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by(le, http_route, http_request_method, server_address) (rate(http_client_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: 95p Backend Request Duration

panels.description: Number of bytes reported by consumed responses Content-Length values. In case of chunked responses, the metrics are not displayed here.
panels.title: Received Content Length

panels.description: Backends that did not report a Content-Length header
panels.title: No Content Length Count

panels.description: Average response content-lenght. Chunked responses are not taken into account.
panels.title: Average Content Length

panels.description: Number of bytes readed from the body. In case a cancel, or a closed connection, the read bytes might not match those of content-lenght. This metric includes chunked responses that do not come with the Content-Length header set.
panels.title: Read Content Size

panels.description: Average Number of bytes readed from the body. In case a cancel, or a closed connection, the read bytes might not match those of content-lenght. This metric includes chunked responses that do not come with the Content-Length header set.
panels.title: Avg Read Content Size

panels.description: Fastest backend response times p95

targets.expr: bottomk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route, http_request_method, server_address) (rate(http_client_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint", http_route!=""}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Fastest p95 endpoints (top $max_list)

panels.description: Slowest backend tesponse times p95

targets.expr: topk($max_list, histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by (le, http_route, server_address, http_request_method) (rate(http_client_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint", http_route!=""}[$__range])))) >= 0

panels.title: Slowest p95 endpoints (top $max_list)

panels.description: The BACKEND requests latency heatmap
panels.title: Latency Heat Map

panels.description: The Response Size Heatmap
panels.title: Response Size Heat Map

panels.description: Failed and timed out requests.
panels.title: Failed and Timed out

panels.description: Requests started vs canceled.
panels.title: Started vs Canceled

targets.expr: sum by(http_route, http_request_method, server_address) (rate(krakend_backend_duration_sum{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval]))/sum by(http_route, http_request_method, server_address) (rate(krakend_backend_duration_count{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: Percentile 95 of backend duration

targets.expr: histogram_quantile(0.95, sum by(le, http_route, http_request_method, server_address) (rate(krakend_backend_duration_bucket{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[$__rate_interval])))

panels.title: p95 backend duration

panels.description: Number of requests initiated

targets.expr: sum by (http_request_method, krakend_endpoint_route, server_address, http_route) (rate(http_client_request_started_count_total{app=~"$app", instance=~"$instance", krakend_endpoint_route=~"$endpoint"}[1m]))

panels.title: Requests Started Count

panels.description: Time spent on garbage collection
panels.title: GC Duration

panels.description: Counts of garbage collection operations per second
panels.title: GC Per Second

panels.description: Garbage collector duration quantiles
panels.title: GC Quantiles

panels.description: Memory in use by the application over time
panels.title: Used Memory

panels.description: Total number of bytes allocated, even if freed.
panels.title: Allocated Memory

panels.description: Total number of frees.
panels.title: Frees

panels.description: Number of allocated objects.
panels.title: Allocated objects

panels.description: Number of heap bytes released to OS.
panels.title: Released memory

panels.description: Idle vs In Use heap memory
panels.title: Heap memory

panels.description: Obtained vs in use stack memory.
panels.title: Stack memory

panels.description: Number of OS threads created.
panels.title: OS Threads

panels.description: Number of live go routines.
panels.title: Goroutines

list.description: The Instance that we want to monitor
list.label: Instance
list.name: instance

list.description: The granularity of the time interval
list.label: Interval
list.name: interval

list.description: Number of elements to display in lists, like top N, or bottom N
list.label: Max items
list.name: max_list

title: KrakenD - OpenTelemetry + Prometheus
